page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT AT BEAFORD
page.content: The main employment in Beaford parish is of course farm work. Most of the 18 farms covered by the grid area are family concerns, and very few farm workers outside the families are employed. Of the electoral roll population, 283 adults, about 15% work on the land. Beaford has a high proportion of elderly and retired people, perhaps 25%. Other employ- ment in the village is limited. The Garage, Post Office, the Beaford Centre, School, Beaford House Hotel, and the Pub can only account for some 20 full and part-time jobs. The majority of workers have to travel to work in nearby towns, using their own transport, and cover a wide variety of jobs. Employment for married women is very limited, and school leavers have to search for jobs in the towns, and find some means of transport as well.
